item.description:
Watch history come alive at the 2009 New England History Festival. The festival is a unique historical revue that combination of slide shows, lectures, reenactors, living history and exhibits. There will be trivia, prizes, concessions and souvenirs.

This year's lineup includes:

JFK: CUBAN MISSILE CRISIS (reenactment of a speech)
ABIGAIL ADAMS (reenactment of the first lady of the American Revolution)
HARRIET TUBMAN (reenactment of the abolotionist and civil war hero)
PASSPORT TO FREEDOM (around the world through secret gates of history)
THE NAKED QUAKER (true crimes and controversies of colonial New England)

There will also be presentations on THE LADY IN BLACK, COLONIAL HEARTH AND KITCHEN, COLONIAL MEDICINE SHOW, NEW ENGLAND IN THE CIVIL WAR , VINEYARD SOUND WATERSPOUT, GREAT SOLAR FLARE, YEAR WITHOUT A SUMMER.

Check out the website at http://www.historyfes...

Tickets cost $15. You are responsible for your own ticket. You can get them through the website using paypal, mail a check to John Horrigan, PO Box 145, Watertown, MA 02471 or call 339-368-1971 for tickets.
item.name: Historapalooza
